snippet: The Russian Orthodox Church leader spoke after a senior church official wrote that the authorities could be “slowly eaten alive” if they did not respond to concerns about last month’s parliamentary elections.
abstract: Russian Orthodox church continues what appears to be an effort to get authorities to address Russians' grievances over the political system, with Patriarch Kirill I, the church's leader, saying in a televised interview that it would be 'a very bad sign' if the country's leaders failed to heed protests over perceived electoral fraud.
lead_paragraph: The Russian Orthodox Church leader spoke after a senior church official wrote that the authorities could be “slowly eaten alive” if they did not respond to concerns about last month’s parliamentary elections.

headline.seo: Patriarch Kirill Urges Russian Leaders to Listen to Protests
headline.main: Head of Russian Church Says Leaders Must Listen to Protests
headline.print_headline: Head of Russian Church Says Leaders Must Listen to Protests
